1.verse: Since many have attempted to set forth the story of those things of which we are fully persuaded

2.verse: (exactly as they were delivered to us by those ministers of the word who saw them themselves from the beginning),

3.verse: it seemed good to me also - once I had carefully investigated all things from the beginning - to write to you thereof from point to point, most noble Theophilus,

4.verse: so that you might acknowledge the certainty of those things of which you have been instructed.

5.verse: In the time of Herod, King of Judea, there was a certain priest named Zacharias, of the class of Abijah. And his wife was among the daughters of Aaron. And her name was Elizabeth.

6.verse: Both were righteous before God and walked in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord, without reproof.

7.verse: And they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren. And both were well-advanced in age.

8.verse: And it so happened that as he executed the priest’s office before God (as per his class),

9.verse: the lot fell to him to burn incense when he went into the Temple of the Lord, according to the custom of the priest’s office.

10.verse: And the whole multitude of the people were outside in prayer while the incense was burning.

11.verse: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the Altar of Incense.

12.verse: And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

13.verse: But the angel said to him, “Fear not, Zacharias. For your prayer is heard, and your wife Elizabeth shall bear you a son. And you shall call his name, John.

14.verse: “And you shall have joy and gladness. And many shall rejoice at his birth.

15.verse: “For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink. And he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.

16.verse: “And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to their Lord God.

17.verse: “For he shall go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”

18.verse: Then Zacharias said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is of a great age.”

19.verse: And the Angel answered, and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I am sent to speak to you, and to show you these good tidings.

20.verse: “And behold, you shall be silent, and unable to speak, until the day that these things are done, because you did not believe my words which shall be fulfilled in their season.”

21.verse: Now the people waited for Zacharias. And they marveled that he remained so long in the Temple.

22.verse: And when he came out, he could not speak to them. Then, they perceived that he had seen a vision in the Temple. For he made signs to them and remained silent.

23.verse: And it happened that when the days of his office were fulfilled, he departed to his own house.

24.verse: And after those days, his wife Elizabeth conceived, and hid herself for five months, saying,

25.verse: “Thus has the Lord dealt with me, in the days on when he looked on me, to take from me my rebuke among men.”

26.verse: And in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

27.verse: to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the House of David. And the virgin’s name was Mary.

28.verse: And the angel went in to her, and said, “Hail, you who are freely beloved. The Lord is with you. You are blessed among women.”

29.verse: And when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying, and thought what kind of greeting that should be.

30.verse: Then the angel said to her, “Do not fear, Mary. For you have found favor with God.

31.verse: “For lo, you shall conceive in your womb, and bear a Son, and shall call His Name, Jesus.

32.verse: “He shall be great and shall be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God shall give to Him the throne of his father David.

33.verse: “And He shall reign over the House of Jacob forever. And of His Kingdom shall be no end.”

34.verse: Then Mary said to the angel, “How shall this be, seeing I do not know man?”

35.verse: And the angel answered, and said to her, “The Holy Ghost shall come upon you, and the power of the Most High shall overshadow you. Therefore, also, that Holy Thing which shall be born by you, shall be called the Son of God.

36.verse: “And behold, your cousin, Elizabeth. She has also conceived a son in her old age. And this is her sixth month, who was called barren.

37.verse: “For with God shall nothing be impossible.”

38.verse: Then Mary said, “Behold the servant of the Lord. May it be to me according to your word.” So, the angel departed from her.

39.verse: And Mary arose in those days and quickly went into the hill country, to a city of Judah,

40.verse: and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.

41.verse: And it happened that, as Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby sprang in her belly. and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost.

42.verse: And she cried with a loud voice, and said, “Blessed are you among women, because the fruit of your womb is blessed!

43.verse: “And how can it be that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

44.verse: “For lo, as soon as I heard the voice of your greeting in my ears, the baby in my belly sprang for joy!

45.verse: “And blessed is she who believed. For those things shall be completed, which were told her from the Lord.

46.verse: Then Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord.

47.verse: “And my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.

48.verse: “For He has looked on the poor degree of His servant. For behold, from now on all ages shall call me blessed.

49.verse: “Because He Who is mighty has done great things for me, and Holy is His Name.

50.verse: “And His mercy is from generation to generation on those who fear Him.

51.verse: “He Who showed strength with His arm, He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

52.verse: “He has put down the mighty from their seats and exalted those of low degree.

53.verse: “He has filled the hungry with good things and sent away the rich empty.

54.verse: “He has upheld Israel, His servant, to be mindful of His mercy,

55.verse: “(as He has spoken to our fathers – that is, to Abraham and his seed) forever.”

56.verse: And Mary stayed with her about three months. After which, she returned to her own house.

57.verse: Now, Elizabeth’s time came for her to be delivered. And she brought forth a Son.

58.verse: And her neighbors and cousins heard tell how the Lord had showed His great mercy upon her. And they rejoiced with her.

59.verse: And it was so that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the baby. And they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

60.verse: But his mother answered, and said, “Not so. But he shall be called John.”

61.verse: And they said to her, “There is no one in your family that is named with this name.”

62.verse: Then they made signs to his father, asking how he would like him called.

63.verse: So he asked for writing tablets, and wrote, saying, “His name is John.” And they all marveled.

64.verse: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue. And he spoke and praised God.

65.verse: Then fear came on all those who lived near them. And all these words were spread throughout all the hill country of Judea.

66.verse: And all those who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What kind of child shall this be?” And the hand of the Lord was with him.

67.verse: Then his father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

68.verse: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, because He has visited and redeemed His people!

69.verse: “And He has raised up the Horn of Salvation unto us, in the House of His servant David,

70.verse: “as He spoke by the mouth of His Holy Prophets. Who were, since the world began, saying,

71.verse: ‘deliverance from our enemies, and from the hands of all that hate us.’

72.verse: “So that He might show mercy towards our fathers, and remember His Holy Covenant -

73.verse: “the oath, which He swore to our father, Abraham -

74.verse: “that he would grant to us. So that we, being delivered out of the hands of our enemies, should serve him without fear

75.verse: “all the days of our life, in holiness and righteousness before him.

76.verse: “And you, child, shall be called the Prophet of the Most High. For you shall go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways,

77.verse: “to give knowledge of salvation to His people, by the remission of their sins

78.verse: “through the tender mercy of our God (whereby the Dayspring from on high has visited us),

79.verse: “to give light to those who sit in darkness (and in the shadow of death), and to guide our feet into the way of peace.”

80.verse: And the child grew and became strong in spirit. And he was in the wilderness until the day came that he should show himself to Israel.

1.verse: And it happened in those days that there came a decree from Augustus Caesar that all the world should be registered.

2.verse: (This first registration was made when Quirinius was Governor of Syria.)

3.verse: Therefore, all went to be registered, everyone to his own city.

4.verse: And Joseph also went up from Galilee (out of a city called Nazareth) into Judea (to the city of David - which is called Bethlehem - because he was of the House and lineage of David)

5.verse: to register with Mary (his betrothed), who was with child.

6.verse: And so it was that while they were there, the days were completed that she should be delivered.

7.verse: And she brought forth her first begotten Son, and wrapped Him in swaddling clothes, and laid Him in a feeding trough (because there was no room for them in the inn).

8.verse: And there were in the same country, shepherds, abiding in the field, and keeping watch over their flock by night.

9.verse: And lo, the Angel of the Lord came upon them. And the glory of the Lord shone about them. And they were very afraid.

10.verse: Then the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid! For behold, I bring you glad tidings of great joy, which shall be to all the people.

11.verse: “For to you is born this day in the City of David, a Savior, Who is Christ the Lord.

12.verse: “And this shall be a sign to you - you shall find the Baby swaddled and laid in a feeding trough.”

13.verse: And immediately, there was with the angel a multitude of Heavenly soldiers, praising God, and saying,

14.verse: “Glory to God in the High Heaven! And peace on Earth! And good will to all who please Him!”

15.verse: And it came to pass, when the angels had gone away from them into Heaven, the shepherds said one to another, “Let us go to Bethlehem, then, and see this thing which has happened, which the Lord has shown to us.”

16.verse: So they came quickly, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the Baby laid in the feeding trough.

17.verse: And when they had seen it, they made known the thing which was told to them about that Child.

18.verse: And all who heard it, marveled at the things which were told to them by the shepherds.

19.verse: But Mary preserved all those sayings and pondered them in her heart.

20.verse: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all that they had heard and seen as it was spoken to them.

21.verse: And when the eighth day had come (on which they circumcised the Child), His Name was then called “Jesus” - which was named by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.

22.verse: And when the days of her purification were completed (according to the Law of Moses), they brought Him to Jerusalem, to present Him to the Lord,

23.verse: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male shall be called holy to the Lord.”)

24.verse: and to give an oblation - as is commanded in the Law of the Lord - a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.

25.verse: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was just and feared God and waited for the consolation of Israel. And the Holy Ghost was upon him.

26.verse: And it was declared to him from God by the Holy Ghost that he should not see death before he had seen the Anointed of the Lord.

27.verse: And he was led by the Spirit into the Temple. And when the parents brought in the Baby Jesus, to do for Him after the custom of the Law,

28.verse: he then took Him in his arms and praised God, and said,

29.verse: “Lord, now let Your servant depart in peace, according to Your word!

30.verse: “For my eyes have seen Your Salvation

31.verse: “(which You have prepared before the face of all people);

32.verse: “a Light to be revealed to the Gentiles and the Glory of Your people, Israel!”

33.verse: And Joseph and his mother marveled at those things which were spoken about Him.

34.verse: And Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, His mother, “Behold, this Child is appointed for the fall and rising again of many in Israel, and for a sign which shall be spoken against,

35.verse: Yes, and a sword shall pierce through your soul, so that the thoughts of many hearts may be opened.”

36.verse: And there was a prophetess - one Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher - who was of a great age (after she had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity).

37.verse: And she had been widowed for about 84 years and had never left the Temple; but had served God with fasting and prayers night and day.

38.verse: Then, coming upon them at that same instant, she likewise confessed the Lord, and spoke of Him to all who looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

39.verse: And when they had performed all things according to the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.

40.verse: And the Child grew, and became strong in Spirit, and was filled with wisdom. And the grace of God was with Him.

41.verse: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.

42.verse: And when He was twelve years old, and they had come up to Jerusalem (after the custom of the feast),

43.verse: and had finished the days and were returning, the child Jesus remained in Jerusalem. And neither Joseph nor his mother, Mary, knew.

44.verse: But they, supposing that He had been in their company, went a day’s journey and sought Him among their kinsfolk and acquaintances.

45.verse: And when they did not find Him, they turned back to Jerusalem and sought Him.

46.verse: And it happened that after three days they found Him in the Temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, hearing them and asking them questions.

47.verse: And all who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and answers.

48.verse: So when they saw Him, they were amazed. And His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You dealt with us like this? Behold, Your father and I have sought You with very heavy hearts.”

49.verse: Then He said to them, “How is it that you sought Me? Did you not know that I must go about My Father’s business?”

50.verse: But they did not understand the word that He spoke to them.

51.verse: Then He went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them. And His mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

52.verse: And Jesus increased in wisdom, and stature, and in favor with God and men.

1.verse: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar - Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being Tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip Tetrarch of Iturea, and of the country of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the Tetrarch of Abilene

2.verse: (when Annas and Caiaphas were the High Priests) - the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.

3.verse: And he came into all the regions around Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins,

4.verse: as it is written in the book of the sayings of Isaiah the Prophet, which says, “The voice of him who cries in the wilderness is, ‘Prepare the way of the Lord! Make His paths straight!

5.verse: ‘Every valley shall be filled. And every mountain and hill shall be brought low. And crooked things shall be made straight, and the rough ways smooth.

6.verse: ‘And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’”

7.verse: Then he said to the people who had come out to be baptized by him, “O generations of vipers! Who has forewarned you to flee from the wrath to come?

8.verse: “Therefore, bring forth fruits worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our Father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children of Abraham from these stones!

9.verse: “Now also is the axe laid to the root of the trees. Therefore, every tree which does not bring forth good fruit shall be cut down and cast into the fire!”

10.verse: Then the people asked him, saying, “What shall we do then?”

11.verse: And he answered, and said to them, “The one having two coats, let him give to the one who has none. And the one who has food, let him do likewise.”

12.verse: Then there came tax collectors to be baptized also, and said to him, “Master, what shall we do?”

13.verse: And he said to them, “Require no more than that which is appointed to you.”

14.verse: The soldiers likewise asked him, saying, “And what shall we do?” And he said to them, “Extort no one, nor accuse anyone falsely. And be content with your wages.”

15.verse: As the people waited expectantly, and everyone wondered in their hearts whether John was the Christ,

16.verse: John answered, and said to them all, “Indeed, I baptize you with water! But One stronger than me comes, Whose sandals I am not worthy to unloose! He will baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire!

17.verse: “His fan is in His hand, and He will make clean his floor, and will gather the wheat into His barn. But the chaff He will burn up with fire that never shall be quenched!”

18.verse: Then, exhorting with many other things, he preached to the people.

19.verse: But when Herod the Tetrarch was rebuked by him (for Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done),

20.verse: he added this above all: that he shut up John in prison.

21.verse: Now it happened that as all the people were baptized, and as Jesus was baptized and prayed, the heaven was opened.

22.verse: And the Holy Ghost came down in a bodily shape like a dove upon Him. And there was a voice from Heaven, saying, “You are My beloved Son. In You I am well pleased.”

23.verse: And Jesus Himself began His ministry at about thirty years of age - being, as men supposed, the Son of Joseph, who was the son of Heli,

24.verse: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Janna, the son of Joseph,

25.verse: the son of Mattathiah, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

26.verse: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathiah, the son of Semei, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,

27.verse: the son of Joannas, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the sonof Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

28.verse: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,

29.verse: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

30.verse: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,

31.verse: The son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattathah, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

32.verse: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,

33.verse: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

34.verse: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

35.verse: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

36.verse: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

37.verse: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Cainan,

38.verse: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

1.verse: And Jesus, full of the Holy Ghost, returned from Jordan and was led by that Spirit into the wilderness,

2.verse: and was tempted forty days by the devil. And in those days, He ate nothing. But after they had ended, He was hungry.

3.verse: Then the devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command this stone, that it be made bread.”

4.verse: But Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread only, but by every word of God.’”

5.verse: Then the devil took Him up into a high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, in the twinkling of an eye.

6.verse: And the devil said to Him, “All this power, and the glory of those kingdoms, will I give You. For that is delivered to me. And to whomever I will, I give it.

7.verse: “Therefore, if You will worship me, they shall be all Yours.”

8.verse: But Jesus answered him, and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him alone You shall serve.’”

9.verse: Then he brought Him to Jerusalem, and set Him on a pinnacle of the Temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, cast Yourself down from here.

10.verse: “For it is written, “He will give His angels charge over you, to keep you.

11.verse: “And with their hands they shall lift you up, lest at any time you should dash your foot against a stone.”

12.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to him, “It is said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”

13.verse: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from Him for a little season.

14.verse: And Jesus returned (by the power of the Spirit) into Galilee. And word spread of Him throughout all the surrounding region.

15.verse: For He taught in their synagogues and was honored by all.

16.verse: And He came to Nazareth, where He had been raised. And as was His custom, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.

17.verse: And the book of the Prophet Isaiah was given to Him. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written,

18.verse: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me, because He has anointed Me, that I should preach the Gospel to the poor. He has sent Me, that I should heal the brokenhearted, that I should preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind; that I should set at liberty them that are bruised,

19.verse: and that I should preach the acceptable year of the Lord.”

20.verse: And He closed the book, and returned it to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all who were in the synagogue were fastened on Him.

21.verse: Then He began to say to them, “This day is the Scripture fulfilled in your ears.”

22.verse: And all bore Him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth, and said, “Is not this Joseph’s son?”

23.verse: Then He said to them, “You will surely say to me this proverb, ‘Physician, heal Yourself. Whatever we have heard was done in Capernaum, do it here also in Your own country.’”

24.verse: And He said, “Truly I say to you, no Prophet is accepted in his own country.

25.verse: “But I tell you the truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when Heaven was shut three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land.

26.verse: “But to none of them was Elijah sent, except to a certain widow in Zarephath, of Sidon.

27.verse: “Also, many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the Prophet. Yet none of them was made clean, except Naaman the Syrian.”

28.verse: When all those in the synagogue heard that, they were filled with wrath,

29.verse: and rose up, and thrust Him out of the city, and led him to the edge of the hill whereupon their city was built, to cast Him over.

30.verse: But He passed through the midst of them, and went His way,

31.verse: and came down into Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them there on the Sabbath days.

32.verse: And they were astonished at His doctrine. For His word was with authority.

33.verse: And there was a man in the synagogue who had a spirit of an unclean demon, which cried with a loud voice,

34.verse: saying, “Oh, what have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth?! Have You come to destroy us?! I know who You are - The Holy One of God!”

35.verse: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet! And come out of him!” Then the demon, throwing him in the midst of them, came out of him and did not hurt him.

36.verse: So fear came upon them all. And they spoke among themselves, saying, “What thing is this? For He commands the foul spirits with authority and power, and they come out!”

37.verse: And the His fame spread throughout all the places of the surrounding countryside.

38.verse: And He rose up, and came out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever, and they required Him for her.

39.verse: Then He stood over her and rebuked the fever. And it left her. And immediately she arose and ministered to them.

40.verse: Now at sunset, all those who had sick of diverse diseases, brought them to Him. And He laid his hands on every one of them and healed them.

41.verse: And demons also came out of many, crying, and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” But He rebuked them and did not allow them to say that they knew Him to be the Christ.

42.verse: And when it was day, He departed and went forth into a desert place. And the people sought Him, and came to Him, and kept Him from leaving.

43.verse: But He said to them, “Surely I must also preach the Kingdom of God to other cities. For that is why I was sent.”

44.verse: And He preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

1.verse: Then it happened that as the people pressed upon Him to hear the word of God, He stood by the lake of Gennesaret

2.verse: and saw two ships stand by the lakeside. But the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.

3.verse: And He entered into one of the ships (which was Simon’s) and asked him to thrust off a little from the land. And he sat down and taught the people from the ship.

4.verse: Now when He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep. And let down your nets to make a catch.”

5.verse: Then Simon answered, and said to Him, “Master, we have worked hard all night and have taken nothing. Nevertheless, at Your word I will let down the net.”

6.verse: And when they had done so, they enclosed a great multitude of fish, so that their net broke.

7.verse: And they beckoned to their partners in the other ship to come and help them. Then they came and filled both the ships, so that they sank.

8.verse: Now when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Lord, go from me. For I am a sinful man.”

9.verse: For he was utterly astonished (and all who were with him) at the catch of fish which they took.

10.verse: And so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were companions of Simon. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not fear. From now on you shall catch men.”

11.verse: And when they had brought the ships to land, they left all and followed Him.

12.verse: Now it happened that when He was in a certain city, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. And when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged Him, saying, “Lord, if You will, You can make me clean.”

13.verse: So he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, saying, “I will. Be clean.” And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

14.verse: And He commanded him that he should tell no one. “But go and show yourself to the priest. And offer as Moses has commanded for your cleansing, for a witness to them.”

15.verse: But His fame spread even more. And great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed of their infirmities by Him.

16.verse: But He kept Himself apart in the wilderness and prayed.

17.verse: And it happened that on a certain day, as He was teaching, the Pharisees and teachers of the Law sat by, who had come out of every town of Galilee, and Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was in him, to heal them.

18.verse: Then behold, men brought a man lying in a bed, who was a paralytic, and they sought means to bring him in, and to lay him before Him.

19.verse: And when they could not find a way by which they might bring him in (because of the crowd), they went up on the house and let him down through the tiling (bed and all) in the midst, before Jesus.

20.verse: And when He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”

21.verse: Then the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this Who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God only?”

22.verse: But when Jesus perceived their reasoning, He answered, and said to them, “Why do you reason in your hearts?

23.verse: “Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you’, or to say, ‘Rise and walk?’”

24.verse: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority to forgive sins on earth, I say to you (said He to the paralytic), Arise. Take up your bed. And go to your house.”

25.verse: And immediately he rose up before them and took up his bed upon which he lay and departed to his own house, praising God.

26.verse: And they were all amazed, and praised God, and were filled with fear, saying, “Doubtless we have seen strange things today!”

27.verse: And after that, He went forth and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax booth, and said to him, “Follow Me.”

28.verse: And he left all, rose up, and followed Him.

29.verse: Then Levi made Him a great feast in his own house, where there was a great multitude of tax collectors, and of others who sat at table with them.

30.verse: But those who were scribes and Pharisees among them, murmured against His disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”

31.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “Those who are whole, do not need the Physician, but those who are sick.

32.verse: I did not come to call the righteous to repentance, but sinners.”

33.verse: Then they said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John often fast and pray, and of the Pharisees also, but Yours eat and drink?”

34.verse: And He said to them, “Can you make the children of the wedding chamber fast, as long as the bridegroom is with them?

35.verse: “But the days will come when even the bridegroom shall be taken away from them. Then shall they fast in those days.”

36.verse: Then He also told them a parable. “No one sews a piece of a new garment into an old one. For then the new tears it, and the piece taken out of the new does not match the old.

37.verse: “Also, no one pours new wine into old vessels. For then the new wine will break the vessels, and it will run out. And the vessels will perish.

38.verse: “But new wine must be poured into new vessels. So that both are preserved.

39.verse: “Also, no one who drinks old wine immediately desires new. For he says, ‘The old is better.’”

1.verse: And it happened that on a second solemn Sabbath, He went through the corn fields. And His disciples plucked the ears of corn and ate and rubbed them in their hands.

2.verse: And certain Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?”

3.verse: Then Jesus answered them, and said, “Have you not read what David did when he himself, and those who were with him, were hungry?

4.verse: “How he went into the house of God and took and ate the showbread, and also gave to those who were with him (which was not lawful to eat, except only for the priests)?”

5.verse: And He said to them, “The Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath day.”

6.verse: It also happened that on another Sabbath, He entered into the synagogue and taught. And there was a man whose right hand was dried up.

7.verse: And the scribes and Pharisees watched Him, to see if He would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against Him.

8.verse: But He knew their thoughts and said to the man who had the withered hand, “Arise, and stand up in the midst.” And he arose and stood up.

9.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you a question: Which is lawful on the Sabbath days - to do good, or to do evil; to save life, or to destroy?”

10.verse: And He looked around at them all and said to the man, “Stretch forth your hand.” And he did so. And his hand was restored again, as whole as the other.

11.verse: Then they were filled with madness and discussed what they might do to Jesus.

12.verse: And it happened that in those days He went into a mountain to pray. And He spent the night in prayer to God.

13.verse: And when it was day, He called His disciples. And He chose twelve of them (whom He also called Apostles):

14.verse: Simon (whom He also named Peter) and Andrew (his brother), James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

15.verse: Matthew and Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zealous,

16.verse: Judas brother of James, and Judas Iscariot (who was also the traitor).

17.verse: Then He came down with them and stood in a plain place with the crowd of His disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judea and Jerusalem and from the seacoasts of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases.

18.verse: And those who were tormented by foul spirits were healed.

19.verse: And the whole multitude sought to touch Him. For power went out of Him and healed them all.

20.verse: And He lifted up His eyes upon His disciples, and said, “Blessed are you poor. For yours is the Kingdom of God.

21.verse: “Blessed are you who hunger now. For you shall be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now. For you shall laugh.

22.verse: “Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they separate you, and revile you, and put out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.

23.verse: “Rejoice on that day and be glad. For behold, your reward is great in Heaven. For in like manner did their fathers to the Prophets:

24.verse: “But woe to you rich. For you have received your comfort.

25.verse: “Woe to you who are full. For you shall hunger. Woe to you who now laugh. For you shall wail and weep.

26.verse: “Woe to you when all men speak well of you. For so did their fathers to the false prophets.

27.verse: “But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies. Do well to those who hate you.

28.verse: “Bless those who curse you and pray for those who hurt you.

29.verse: “And to the one who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other, and the one who takes away your cloak, do not forbid to take your coat also.

30.verse: “Give to everyone who asks of you. And from the one who takes away what is yours, do not ask for it back.

31.verse: “And as you would have men do to you, so likewise do to them.

32.verse: “For if you love those who love you, what thanks shall you have? For even the sinners love those who love them.

33.verse: And if you love those who love you, what thanks shall you have? For even the sinners do the same.

34.verse: “And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what thanks shall you have? For even the sinners lend to sinners to receive the same.

35.verse: “Therefore, love your enemies. And do good. And lend, looking for nothing in return. And your reward shall be great. And you shall be the children of the Most High. For He is kind to the ungrateful and to the evil.

36.verse: “Therefore, be merciful, as your Father is also merciful.

37.verse: “Do not judge. And you shall not be judged. Do not condemn. And you shall not be condemned. Forgive, and you shall be forgiven.

38.verse: “Give, and it shall be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, shall be laid in your lap. For with what measure you measure, it shall be measured to you again.”

39.verse: And He spoke a parable to them, “Can the blind lead the blind? Shall they not both fall into the ditch?

40.verse: “The disciple is not above the master. But whoever would be a perfect disciple shall be as his master.

41.verse: “And why do you see a splinter in your brother’s eye, yet do not consider the beam that is in your own eye?

42.verse: “Or, how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me pull out the splinter that is in your eye,’ when you do not see the beam that is in your own eye? Hypocrite! Cast out the beam from your own eye first. And then you shall see perfectly to pull out the splinter that is in your brother’s eye.

43.verse: “For it is not a good tree that brings forth evil fruit, nor an evil tree that brings forth good fruit.

44.verse: “For every tree is known by its own fruit. For figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes gathered from bushes.

45.verse: “A good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth good. And an evil man, out of the evil treasure of his heart, brings forth evil. For out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.

46.verse: “But why do you call Me ‘Lord, Lord’ and do not do the things that I speak?

47.verse: “Whoever comes to Me and hears My words, and does the same, I will show you to whom he is like.

48.verse: “He is like a man who built a house, and dug deep, and laid the foundation on a rock. And when the waters rose, the flood beat upon that house, but could not shake it. For it was grounded upon a rock.

49.verse: “But the one who hears and does not do, is like a man who built a house upon the earth without foundation (against which the flood beat, and it immediately fell). And the fall of that house was great.”

1.verse: When He had ended all His sayings in the hearing of the people, He entered into Capernaum.

2.verse: And a certain centurion’s servant (who was dear to him) was sick and ready to die.

3.verse: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent the elders of the Jews to Him, asking Him to come and heal his servant.

4.verse: So they came to Jesus and pleaded with Him earnestly, saying “He is worthy. You should do this for him.

5.verse: “For he loves our Nation, and he has built us a synagogue.”

6.verse: Then Jesus went with them. But when He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself. For I am not worthy that You should enter under my roof.

7.verse: “Therefore I did not think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant shall be whole.

8.verse: “For I am also a man set under authority and have soldiers under me. And I say to one, ‘Go.’ And he goes. And to another, ‘Come.’ And he comes. And to my servant, ‘Do this.’ And he does it.”

9.verse: When Jesus heard these things, He marveled at him. And He turned and said to the people who followed him, “I say to you, I have not found so great faith! No. Not in Israel.”

10.verse: And when those who were sent returned to the house, they found the servant who had been sick, whole.

11.verse: And it happened that the next day, He went into a city called Nain. And many of His disciples went with Him, and a great multitude.

12.verse: Now when He came near to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out - the only begotten son of his mother, who was a widow - and many people of the city were with her.

13.verse: And when the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her, and said to her, “Do not weep.”

14.verse: And He went and touched the coffin. And those who bore him stood still. And He said, “Young man, I say to you, ‘Arise.’”

15.verse: And the dead man sat up and began to speak. And He gave him to his mother.

16.verse: Then a fear came upon them all. And they glorified God, saying, “A great Prophet is risen among us! And God has visited His people!”

17.verse: And this word of Him went forth throughout all Judea, and throughout all the surrounding region.

18.verse: And the disciples of John reported all these things to him.

19.verse: So John called two certain men of his disciples, and sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are You the coming One? Or shall we wait for another?”

20.verse: And when the men had come to Him, they said, “John Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the coming One? Or shall we wait for another?’”

21.verse: And at that time, He cured many of their sicknesses and plagues and evil spirits. And He gave sight freely to many of the blind.

22.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, “Go your ways and show John what things you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor receive the Gospel.

23.verse: “And whoever does not stumble because of Me is blessed.”

24.verse: And when the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the people of John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see - a reed shaken with the wind?

25.verse: “But what did you go out to see - a man clothed in soft garments? Behold, those who are gorgeously appareled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

26.verse: “But what did you go forth to see - a Prophet? ‘Yes’, I say to you, ‘and greater than a Prophet.’

27.verse: “This is He of Whom it is written: ‘Behold, I send My messenger before your face, who shall prepare Your way before You.’

28.verse: “For I say to you there is no greater Prophet than John among those who are born of women. Nevertheless, whoever is the least in the Kingdom of God, is greater than him.”

29.verse: Then all the people who heard, and the tax collectors, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.

30.verse: But the Pharisees and the expounders of the Law despised the counsel of God against themselves and were not baptized by him.

31.verse: And the Lord said, “To what shall I liken the men of this generation? And what are they like?

32.verse: “They are like little children sitting in the marketplace, crying one to another, saying, ‘We have played the flute for you, and you have not danced. We have mourned for you, and you have not wept.’

33.verse: “For John Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine. And you say, ‘He has a demon.’

34.verse: “The Son of Man has come, and eats, and drinks. And you say, ‘Behold, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

35.verse: “But wisdom is justified by all her children.”

36.verse: And one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. And He went into the Pharisee’s house and sat down at table.

37.verse: And behold, a woman in the city (who was a sinner), when she knew that Jesus sat at table in the Pharisee’s house, brought a box of ointment.

38.verse: And she stood behind him, weeping at his feet. And she began to wash his feet with her tears. And she wiped them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

39.verse: Now when the Pharisee who had asked Him, saw it, he spoke to himself, saying, “If this man were a Prophet, He would surely have known who and what kind of woman this is who touches Him. For she is a sinner.”

40.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” And he said, “Master, say on.”

41.verse: “There was a certain lender who had two debtors. One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

42.verse: “When they had nothing with which to pay, he forgave them both. Therefore, tell Me, which of them will love him most?”

43.verse: Simon answered, and said, “I suppose the one to whom he forgave most.” And He said to him, “You have judged rightly.”

44.verse: Then he turned to the woman, and said to Simon, “See this woman? I entered into your house and you gave Me no water for my feet. But she has washed my feet with tears and wiped them with the hairs of her head.

45.verse: “You gave Me no kiss. But since the time I came in, she has not ceased to kiss My feet.

46.verse: “You did not anoint My head with oil. But she has anointed My feet with ointment.

47.verse: “Therefore I say to you her many sins are forgiven. For she has loved much. But the one to whom little is forgiven, loves little.”

48.verse: And he said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”

49.verse: And those who sat at table with Him began to say among themselves, “Who is this Who even forgives sins?”

50.verse: And He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

1.verse: And afterward, it happened that He went through every city and town, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the Kingdom of God. And the twelve were with Him,

2.verse: as well as certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities (such as Mary, called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils;

3.verse: and Joanna, the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward; and Susanna; and many others who ministered to Him from their possessions).

4.verse: Now when many people had gathered together and come to Him out of all the cities, He spoke a parable.

5.verse: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside. And it was trampled underfoot, and the birds of heaven devoured it.

6.verse: “And some fell on the stones. And after it sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

7.verse: “And some fell among thorns. And the thorns sprang up with it and choked it.

8.verse: “And some fell on good ground. And it sprang up and bore fruit, a hundredfold.” And as He said these things, He cried, “The one who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

9.verse: Then His disciples asked Him what parable that was.

10.verse: And He said, “To you it is given to know the secrets of the Kingdom of God. But to others they come in parables. So that when they see, they will not see. And when they hear, they will not understand.

11.verse: “The parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

12.verse: “And that which are along the way are those who hear, but afterward the devil comes and takes away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

13.verse: “But the ones on the stones are those who, when they have heard the word, receive it with joy. But they have no roots. So, for a while they believe, but in the time of temptation they go away.

14.verse: “And that which fell among thorns are those who have heard, but after their departure are choked with cares and riches and the pursuit of pleasure. And they bring forth no fruit.

15.verse: “But that which fell in good ground are those who hear the word with an honest and good heart, and keep it, and bring forth fruit through patience.

16.verse: “No one, when he lights a candle, hides it under a vessel, or puts it under the bed. But he sets it on a candlestick, so that those who enter may see the light.

17.verse: “For nothing is secret that shall not be evident. Nor is anything hidden that shall not be known, and come to light.

18.verse: “Therefore, watch how you hear. For whoever has, to him shall be given. And whoever has not, even that which he seems to have shall be taken from him.

19.verse: “Then his mother and his brothers came to Him. And they could not come near to Him because of the crowd.

20.verse: And someone said to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, and wish see You.

21.verse: But He answered, and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are those who hear the word of God and do it.”

22.verse: And it happened that on a certain day, He went into a ship with His disciples. And He said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” And they launched forth.

23.verse: And as they sailed, He fell asleep. And a storm of wind came down on the lake. And they were filling with water and were in danger.

24.verse: Then they went to Him, and awoke Him, saying, “Master! Master! We are going to die!” And He arose and rebuked the wind and the waves. And they ceased. And it was calm.

25.verse: Then He said to them, “Where is your faith?” And they feared, and wondered among themselves, saying, “Who is this Who commands both the winds and water? And they obey Him!”

26.verse: So they sailed to the region of the Gadarenes (which is near Galilee).

27.verse: And as He went out to land, a certain man from the city met Him. He had had demons for a long time, and he wore no clothes. Nor did he live in a house, but in the graves.

28.verse: And when he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before Him. And with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with You, Jesus the Son of God, the Most High? I beg You, do not torment me!”

29.verse: For He commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. It had often seized him. Therefore, he was bound with chains and kept in shackles. But he broke the bonds and was carried into wilderness by the demon.

30.verse: Then Jesus asked him, saying, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion!” (because many demons had entered into him).

31.verse: And they begged him not to command them to go out into the deep.

32.verse: And there was a large herd of swine feeding on a nearby hill. And the demons begged Him to let them to enter them. So, He allowed them.

33.verse: Then the demons went out of the man and entered into the swine. And the herd was carried violently down a steep bank into the lake and was choked.

34.verse: When the herdsmen saw what was done, they fled. And when they had left, they reported it in the city and in the country.

35.verse: Then they came out to see what had happened. And they came to Jesus and found the man out of whom the demons had come, sitting at the feet of Jesus (clothed, and in his right mind). And they were afraid.

36.verse: Those who saw it also told them by what means he who had been possessed with the demon was healed.

37.verse: Then the whole multitude of the country surrounding the Gadarenes begged Him to leave, for they were taken with great fear. And He went into the ship and returned.

38.verse: Then the man out of whom the demons had come begged Him to let him stay with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,

39.verse: “Return to your own house. And show what great things God has done to you.” So, he went his way, and preached throughout all the city what great things Jesus had done to him.

40.verse: And it happened that when Jesus returned, the people welcomed Him. For they all waited for Him.

41.verse: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, who was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged Him to come to his house.

42.verse: For he had an only daughter (about twelve years of age) who lay dying. And as He went, the people thronged Him.

43.verse: And a woman having a twelve-year-long flow of blood (who had spent all she had on physicians, and could not be healed by any)

44.verse: came behind Him. And she touched the hem of His garment. And immediately her flow of blood stopped.

45.verse: Then Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” When everyone denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitude jostles You, and presses against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’”

46.verse: And Jesus said, “Someone touched Me. For I perceive that power has gone out of Me.”

47.verse: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came, trembling, and fell down before Him. And before all the people, she told Him why she had touched Him, and how she had been healed immediately.

48.verse: And He said to her, “Daughter, be of good courage. Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

49.verse: While He was still speaking, someone from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came and said to Him, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Master.”

50.verse: When Jesus heard it, He answered him, saying, “Do not fear. Only believe, and she shall be saved.”

51.verse: And when He went to the house, He did not allow anyone to go in with Him except Peter and James and John, and the father and mother of the maid.

52.verse: And all wept and mourned for her. But He said, “Do not weep. For she is not dead, but sleeps.”

53.verse: And they ridiculed Him, knowing that she was dead.

54.verse: So He sent them all out. And He took her by the hand and cried, saying, “Little girl, arise!”

55.verse: Then her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. And He commanded to give her food.

56.verse: Then her parents were astonished. But He commanded them to tell no one what had happened.

1.verse: Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to heal diseases.

2.verse: And He sent them forth to preach the Kingdom of God, and to cure the sick.

3.verse: And He said to them, “Take nothing on your journey, neither staff, nor bag, nor bread, nor money; nor have two tunics apiece.

4.verse: “And whatever house you enter, stay there, and leave from there.

5.verse: “And however many will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”

6.verse: And they went out and went through every town preaching the Gospel and healing everywhere.

7.verse: Now Herod the Tetrarch heard of all that had been done by Him. And he doubted, because it was said by some that John had risen again from the dead.

8.verse: And by some that Elijah had appeared. And by some that one of the old Prophets had risen again.

9.verse: Then Herod said, “John I have beheaded. Who then is this of Whom I hear such things?” And he sought to see Him.

10.verse: And when the Apostles returned, they told Him what great things they had done. Then He took them and went aside into a solitary place, near the city called Bethsaida.

11.verse: But when the people knew of it, they followed Him. And He received them, and spoke to them of the Kingdom of God, and healed those needing to be healed.

12.verse: And when the day began to wear away, the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the people away, so that they may go into the surrounding towns and villages, and lodge, and get food. For we are here in a desert place.

13.verse: But He said to them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”

14.verse: For there were about five thousand men. Then He said to His disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of fifty.”

15.verse: And they did so and made all sit down.

16.verse: Then He took the five loaves, and the two fish, and looked up to Heaven and blessed them; and broke and gave to the disciples to set before the people.

17.verse: So they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces from what remained.

18.verse: And it happened that as He was alone praying, His disciples were with Him. And He asked them, saying, “Whom do the people say that I am?”

19.verse: They answered, and said, “John Baptist. And others say, Elijah. And some say that one of the old Prophets has risen again.”

20.verse: And He said to them, “But Whom do you say that I am?” Peter answered, and said, “The Christ of God.”

21.verse: And He warned and commanded them to tell that to no one,

22.verse: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, and by the chief priests and scribes, and be killed; and the third day rise again.”

23.verse: And He said to them all, “If anyone would come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow Me.

24.verse: “For whoever would save his life, shall lose it. And whoever shall lose his life, for my sake, the same shall save it.

25.verse: "For what does it benefit a man if he wins the whole world and destroys himself, or loses himself?

26.verse: “For whoever shall be ashamed of Me and My words, of him shall the Son of Man be ashamed when He shall come in His own glory, and in the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

27.verse: “And I tell you truly, there are some standing here who shall not taste of death till they have seen the Kingdom of God.”

28.verse: And it happened that about eight days after those words, He took Peter and John, and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.

29.verse: And as He prayed, the appearance of His face was changed. And His clothes became white and radiant.

30.verse: And behold, two men talked with Him (who were Moses and Elijah),

31.verse: They appeared in glory and told of His departure which he would accomplish at Jerusalem.

32.verse: But Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep. And when they awoke, they saw His glory, and the two men standing with him.

33.verse: And it happened that as they departed from Him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Therefore, let us make three tabernacles: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.

34.verse: While he said this, a cloud came and overshadowed them. And they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.

35.verse: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Hear Him.”

36.verse: And after the voice spoke, Jesus was found alone. And they kept it secret and told no one in those days anything they had seen.

37.verse: And it happened that on the next day, as they came down from the mountain, many people met Him.

38.verse: And behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying, “Master, I beg You! Look upon my son! For he is all that I have!

39.verse: “And lo, a spirit takes him, and suddenly he cries. And he convulses him, so that he foams at the mouth. And when he has bruised him, he departs from him roughly.

40.verse: “Now I have begged Your disciples to cast him out, but they could not.

41.verse: Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation! How long now shall I be with you, and bear with you? Bring your son here.”

42.verse: And while He was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and returned him to his father.

43.verse: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. And while they all wondered at all the things which Jesus did, He said to His disciples,

44.verse: “Let these words sink down into your ears. For the time will come when the Son of Man shall be delivered into the hands of men.”

45.verse: But they did not understand that word, for it was hidden from them. So, they could not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask Him about that word.

46.verse: Then a dispute arose among them: which one of them should be the greatest.

47.verse: When Jesus saw the thoughts of their hearts, He took a little child and set him by Him.

48.verse: And He said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in My Name, receives Me. And whoever shall receive Me, receives Him Who sent Me. For the one who is least among you all shall be great.”

49.verse: And John answered and said, “Master, we saw one casting out demons in Your Name, and we forbade him because he does not follow with us.

50.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Do not forbid him. For whoever is not against us, is with us.”

51.verse: And it happened that when it was time for Him to be received up, He set His face to go to Jerusalem,

52.verse: And sent messengers before Him. And they went and entered into a town of the Samaritans, to prepare for Him.

53.verse: But they would not receive Him, because His face was set toward Jerusalem.

54.verse: And when His disciples James and John saw it, they said, “Lord, do You want us to command that fire come down from Heaven and consume them, just as Elijah did?”

55.verse: But Jesus turned around and rebuked them, and said, “You do not know of what spirit you are.

56.verse: “For the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.” Then they went to another town.

57.verse: And it happened that as they went on the way, a certain man said to Him, “I will follow You, Lord, wherever You go!”

58.verse: And Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the heaven nests. But the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”

59.verse: But He said to another, “Follow Me.” But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”

60.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their dead. But go and preach the Kingdom of God.”

61.verse: Then another said, “I will follow You, Lord. But first let me go and bid farewell to those who are at my house.

62.verse: And Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plough and looks back is fit for the Kingdom of God.”

1.verse: After these things, the Lord also appointed seventy others and sent them, two by two, before Him into every city and place where He Himself would come.

2.verse: And He said to them, “The harvest is great, but the laborers are few. Therefore, pray the Lord of the Harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.

3.verse: “Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.

4.verse: “Carry no money bag, nor sack, nor shoes, and greet no one on the way.

5.verse: “And into whatever house you enter, say first, ‘Peace to this house.’

6.verse: “And if a son of peace is there, your peace shall rest upon him. If not, it shall return to you again.

7.verse: “And remain in that same house, eating and drinking what they give. For the laborer is worthy of his wages. Do not go from house to house.

8.verse: “But into whatever city you shall enter, if they receive you, eat what is set before you,

9.verse: “and heal the sick who are there, and say to them, ‘The Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

10.verse: “But in whatever city you enter, if they will not receive you, go out into the streets of that city, and say,

11.verse: “‘Even the very dust of your city, which clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless, know this: that the Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

12.verse: “For I say to you that it shall be easier on that Day for those of Sodom, than for that city.

13.verse: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles which have been done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

14.verse: “Therefore it shall be easier for Tyre and Sidon at the Judgment than for you.

15.verse: “And you, Capernaum, who is exalted to Heaven, shall be thrust down to Hades.

16.verse: “The one who hears you, hears Me. And the one who despises you, despises Me. And the one who despises Me, despises Him Who sent Me.”

17.verse: And the seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us through Your Name!”

18.verse: And He said to them, “I saw Satan fall down, like lightning, from Heaven.

19.verse: “Behold, I give you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. And nothing shall hurt you.

20.verse: Nevertheless, do not rejoice in this: that the spirits obey you. But rather, rejoice because your names are written in Heaven.”

21.verse: That same hour, Jesus rejoiced in the Spirit, and said, “I confess to You, Father, Lord of Heaven and Earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and have revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, because it so pleased You.

22.verse: “All things are given to Me by My Father. And no one knows Who the Son is, except the Father; nor Who the Father is, except the Son and him to whom the Son wishes to reveal Him.”

23.verse: And He turned to His disciples, and said secretly, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.

24.verse: “For I tell you that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which you see and have not seen them; and to hear those things which you hear, and have not heard them.

25.verse: Then behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tempted Him, saying, “Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

26.verse: And He said to him, “What is written in the Law? How do you read it?”

27.verse: And he answered and said, “You shall love your Lord God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your thought, and your neighbor as yourself.”

28.verse: Then He said to him, “You have answered right. Do this, and you shall live.”

29.verse: But he, wishing to justify himself, said to Jesus, “Who, then, is my neighbor?”

30.verse: And Jesus answered, and said, “A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell among thieves. And they robbed him of his clothes and wounded him and departed, leaving him half-dead.

31.verse: “Now by chance, a certain priest came down that same way. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

32.verse: “And likewise, a Levite, when he had come near the place, went and looked, and passed by on the other side.

33.verse: “Then a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came near him. And when he saw him, he had compassion on him.

34.verse: “And he went to him and bound up his wounds and poured in oil and wine. And he put him on his own beast and brought him to an Inn and made provision for him.

35.verse: “And the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. And whatever more you spend I will repay when I return.’

36.verse: “Now, which of these three do you think was a neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?”

37.verse: And he said, “The one who showed mercy on him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go, and do likewise.”

38.verse: Now it happened that as they went, He entered into a certain town. And a certain woman named Martha received Him into her house.

39.verse: And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard His preaching.

40.verse: But Martha was distracted by much serving. And she came to Him, and said, “Master, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore, command her to help me.”

41.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to her, “Martha, Martha. You are anxious and troubled about many things.

42.verse: “But one thing is needed, Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.”

1.verse: And so it was that as He was praying in a certain place, when He ceased, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray as John also taught his disciples.”

2.verse: And He said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father, Who are in Heaven, hallowed be Your Name. Your Kingdom come. Let Your will be done even on Earth, as in Heaven.

3.verse: ‘Give us our daily bread each day.

4.verse: ‘And forgive us our sins. As we also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. And do not lead us into trial. But deliver us from the evil one.’”

5.verse: Moreover He said to them, “Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight, and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves.

6.verse: ‘For a friend of mine has come out of the way to me, and I have nothing to set before him.’

7.verse: “And the one inside answers, and says, ‘Do not trouble me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I cannot rise and give them to you?’

8.verse: “I say to you that though he would not rise and give to him because he is his friend, yet he would undoubtedly rise and give him as many as he needed because of his persistence.

9.verse: “And I say to you, ask, and it shall be given to you. Seek, and you shall find. Knock, and it shall be opened to you.

10.verse: “For everyone who asks, receives. And the one who seeks, finds. And to the one who knocks, it shall be opened.

11.verse: “If a son shall ask for bread from any of you who is a father, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent instead?

12.verse: “Or if he asks for an egg, will he give him a scorpion?

13.verse: “If you, then, who are evil, can give good gifts to your children, how much more shall your Heavenly Father give the Holy Ghost to those who desire Him?

14.verse: Then He cast out a demon who was dumb. And when the demon had gone out, the dumb spoke, and the people wondered.

15.verse: But some of them said, “He casts out demons through Beelzebub, the chief of the demons.

16.verse: And others tempted Him, seeking a sign from Heaven from Him.

17.verse: But He knew their thoughts, and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself, shall be desolate. And a house divided against a house, falls.

18.verse: So, if Satan is also divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons through Beelzebub?

19.verse: If I cast out demons through Beelzebub, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore, they shall be your judges.

20.verse: But if I cast out demons by the finger of God, doubtless the Kingdom of God has come to you.

21.verse: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his house, the things that he possesses are in peace.

22.verse: But when someone stronger comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes away all the armor in which he had trusted and divides his spoils.

23.verse: “Whoever is not with Me, is against Me. And whoever does not gather with Me, scatters.

24.verse: “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a man, he walks through dry places, seeking rest. And when he finds none, he says, ‘I will return to the house from where I came out.’

25.verse: “And when he comes, he finds it swept and put in order.

26.verse: “Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits worse than himself. And they enter in, and dwell there. So, the last state of that man is worse than the first.”

27.verse: And it happened that as He said these things, a certain woman in the crowd lifted up her voice, and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which You have sucked.”

28.verse: But He said, “On the contrary. Blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it.”

29.verse: And when the people were thickly gathered together, He began to say, “This is a wicked generation! They seek a sign. And no sign shall be given to them, except the sign of Jonah the Prophet.

30.verse: “For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so also shall the Son of Man be to this generation.

31.verse: “The Queen of the South shall rise in judgment with the men of this generation and shall condemn them. For she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And behold, a Greater than Solomon is here.

32.verse: “The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation and shall condemn it. For they repented at the preaching of Jonah. And behold, a Greater than Jonah is here.

33.verse: “No one, when he has lit a candle, puts it in a private place, or under a bushel, but on a candlestick. So that those who come in may see the light.

34.verse: “The light of the body is the eye. Therefore, when your eye is sound, then your whole body is light. But if your eye is evil, then your body is dark.

35.verse: “Take care, therefore, that the light which is in you is not darkness.

36.verse: “Therefore, if your whole body is full of light - having no part darkness - then all shall be light (just as when a candle lights you with its brightness).”

37.verse: And as He spoke, a certain Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. And He went in and sat down at the table.

38.verse: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner.

39.verse: And the Lord said to him, “Indeed you Pharisees make the outside of the cup and the platter clean, but the inward part is full of plundering and wickedness.

40.verse: “You fools. Did not He Who made that which is outside also make that which is inside?

41.verse: “Therefore, give alms from those things which you have. And behold, all things shall be clean to you.

42.verse: “But woe to you, Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and all kinds of herbs but pass over judgment and the love of God. These you ought to have done while not leaving the other undone.

43.verse: “Woe to you, Pharisees! For you love the uppermost seats in the synagogues and greetings in the markets.

44.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees! Hypocrites! For you are as unseen graves, and the men who walk over them are unaware.”

45.verse: Then one of the lawyers answered, and said to Him, “Master, by saying this, You insult us also.”

46.verse: And He said, “Woe to you also, you lawyers! For you load men with heavy burdens to bear. And you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.

47.verse: “Woe to you! For you build the sepulchers of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

48.verse: “Truly you bear witness and approve the deeds of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their sepulchers.

49.verse: “Therefore the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles. And of them they shall kill and persecute,’

50.verse: “so that the blood of all the prophets, shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation,

51.verse: “from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah (who was killed between the altar and the Temple) truly I say to you, it shall be required of this generation.

52.verse: “Woe to you, lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter in yourselves, and those who came in you hindered.”

53.verse: And as He said these things to them, the scribes and Pharisees began to plead with Him angrily, and to provoke Him to speak of many things,

54.verse: lying in wait for Him, seeking to catch something from His mouth by which they might accuse Him.

1.verse: In the meantime, there gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, so that they trampled one another. And He began to say to His disciples first, “Beware the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

2.verse: “For there is nothing covered that shall not be revealed or hidden that shall not be known.

3.verse: “Therefore, whatever you have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light. And that which you have spoken in the ear, in secret places, shall be preached on the houses.

4.verse: “And I say to you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, but after that are not able to do anymore.

5.verse: “But I will forewarn you of Whom you shall fear. Fear Him Who, after He has killed, has power to cast into hell. Yes, I say to you, fear Him.

6.verse: “Are not five sparrows bought for two assaria? Yet not one of them is forgotten before God.

7.verse: “Yes, and all the hairs of your head are numbered. Therefore, do not fear. You are of more value than many sparrows.

8.verse: “Also I say to you whoever shall confess Me before men, him shall the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God.

9.verse: “But whoever shall deny Me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

10.verse: “And whoever shall speak a word against the Son of Man, it shall be forgiven him. But to him who shall blaspheme the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven.

11.verse: “And when they shall bring you to the synagogues, and to the rulers and princes, take no thought how or what you shall answer, or what you shall speak.

12.verse: “For the Holy Ghost shall teach you at the same hour what you ought to say.

13.verse: “And one of the crowd said to Him, “Master, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”

14.verse: And He said to him, “Man, who made Me a judge or a divider over you?”

15.verse: Therefore He said to them, “Perceive and beware of covetousness. For though one has abundance, his life does not consist of his riches.”

16.verse: And He put forth a parable to them, saying, “The ground of a certain rich man brought forth fruits plentifully.

17.verse: “Therefore he thought to himself, saying, ‘What shall I do? I have no place to store my fruits?’

18.verse: “And He said, ‘I will do this. I will pull down my barns and build bigger ones. And I will gather all my grain and my goods in there.

19.verse: ‘And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Live at ease. Eat, drink, and be merry!”

20.verse: “But God said to him, ‘O fool! This night your soul shall be required from you. Then whose things shall those be which you have provided?

21.verse: “So is the one who gathers riches for himself and is not rich toward God.”

22.verse: And He spoke to His disciples, “Therefore I say to you take no thought for your life (what you shall eat) or for your body (what you shall wear).

23.verse: “Life is more than food, and the body than the clothing.

24.verse: “Consider the ravens. For they neither sow nor reap. Nor do they have storehouse or barn. And yet God feeds them. How much better are you than birds?

25.verse: “And who of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?

26.verse: “If you then are not able to do the least thing, why do you worry about the rest?

27.verse: “Consider how the lilies grow. They neither labor nor spin. Yet I say to you that Solomon himself, in all his royalty, was not clothed like one of these.

28.verse: “If then God so clothes the grass (which is in the field today, and tomorrow is cast into the oven) how much more will he clothe you? O you of little faith!

29.verse: “Therefore, do not ask what you shall eat or what you shall drink, or have an anxious mind.

30.verse: “For the people of the world all seek for such things. And your Father knows that you need these things.

31.verse: “But rather, seek the Kingdom of God, and all these things shall be added to you.

32.verse: “Do not fear, little flock. For it is your Father’s pleasure to give you the Kingdom.

33.verse: “Sell what you have and give alms. Make purses which do not grow old - a treasure that can never fail in Heaven - where no thief comes or moth destroys.

34.verse: “For where your treasure is, there your hearts will be also.

35.verse: “Let your waist be girded, your lights burning,

36.verse: “and you yourselves like men who wait for their master to return from the wedding feast. So that when he comes and knocks, they may open to him immediately.

37.verse: “Blessed those servants whom the Lord shall find awake when He comes. Truly I say to you, He will gird himself, make them sit down at table, and come forth and serve them.

38.verse: “And if He comes in the second watch, or comes in the third watch, and shall find them so, blessed are those servants.

39.verse: “Now understand this: that if the good man of the house had known at what hour the thief would have come, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

40.verse: “Therefore, you also be prepared. For the Son of Man will come at an hour you do not suspect.”

41.verse: Then Peter said to Him, “Master, did You tell this parable only to us, or to everyone?”

42.verse: And the Lord said, “Who is a faithful steward, and wise; whom the master shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of food in season?

43.verse: “Blessed is that servant whom his master, when he comes, shall find so doing.

44.verse: “Truly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all that he has.

45.verse: “But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master delays his coming’, and begins to beat the servants and maidens, and to eat and drink and get drunk,

46.verse: “the master of that servant will come on a day he does not suspect, and at an hour when he is unaware, and will cut him off, and give him his portion with the unbelievers.

47.verse: “And that servant who knew his master’s will and neither prepared himself nor did according to his will, shall be beaten with many lashes.

48.verse: “But the one who did not know it and still committed things worthy of lashes, shall be beaten with few. For to whom much is given, much shall be required. And to whom much has been committed, much more will be requested.

49.verse: “I have come to cast fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!
