50.verse: “But I must be baptized with a baptism, and how I am grieved till it be accomplished.

51.verse: “Do you think that I have come to give peace on earth? I tell you no, but rather division.

52.verse: “For from now on there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

53.verse: “The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”

54.verse: Then He said to the people, “When you see a cloud rise out of the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower comes.’ And so it does.

55.verse: “And when the south wind blows, you say that it will be hot. And it happens.

56.verse: “Hypocrites! You can discern the face of the earth and of the sky. But why can you not discern this time?

57.verse: “Indeed, and why do you not judge what is right even among yourselves?

58.verse: “While you go with your adversary to the ruler, work diligently on the way to be delivered from him. Lest he draws you to the judge and the judge delivers you to the jailer. And the jailer casts you into prison.

59.verse: I tell you, you shall not depart from there till you have paid the last cent.

1.verse: There were some present at the same time who told Him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

2.verse: And Jesus answered, and said to them, “Do you suppose that because they have suffered such things, these Galileans were greater sinners than all the other Galileans?

3.verse: “I tell you no. But unless you repent, you shall all likewise perish.

4.verse: “Or do you think that those eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell (and it killed them) were sinners above all men living in Jerusalem?

5.verse: “I tell you no. But unless you repent, you shall all likewise perish.”

6.verse: He also spoke this parable: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. And he came and sought fruit from it and found none.

7.verse: “Then he said to the dresser of his vineyard, ‘Behold, for three years I have come and sought fruit from this fig tree and found none. Cut it down! Why is it wasting ground?’

8.verse: “And he answered, and said to him, ‘Lord, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.

9.verse: ‘And if it bears fruit, well. If not, then after that cut it down.’”

10.verse: And He taught in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath Day.

11.verse: And behold, there was a woman who had had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years. And was doubled over and could not straighten up at all.

12.verse: When Jesus saw her, He called her to Him, and said to her, “Woman, you are free from your disease.”

13.verse: And He laid His hands on her. And immediately she was made straight again. And she glorified God.

14.verse: [i]And the ruler of the Synagogue answered indignantly (because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath) and said to the people, “There are six days in which we ought to work! Therefore, come and be healed on those days, and not on the Sabbath day!”

15.verse: Then the Lord answered him, and said, “Hypocrite. Does not each one of you free his ox or his ass from the stall on the Sabbath and lead him away to the water?

16.verse: “And ought not this daughter of Abraham (whom Satan has bound, lo, eighteen years) be freed from this bond on the Sabbath day?”

17.verse: And when He said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed. But all the people rejoiced at all the excellent things that were done by Him.

18.verse: Then He said, “What is the Kingdom of God like? Or, to what shall I compare it?

19.verse: “It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his garden. And it grew and became a great tree. And the birds of the heaven made nests in its branches.”

20.verse: And again He said, “To what shall I liken the Kingdom of God?

21.verse: “It is like leaven. Which a woman took and hid in three pecks of flour, till it all was leavened.”

22.verse: And He went through all cities and towns, teaching and journeying towards Jerusalem.

23.verse: Then someone said to Him, “Lord, are there few who shall be saved?” And He said to them,

24.verse: “Strive to enter in at the narrow gate. For many, I say to you, will seek to enter in and shall not be able.

25.verse: “When the master of the house has risen up and has shut the door; and you began to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open for us’, and he shall answer and say to you, ‘I do not know where you are from.’

26.verse: “Then you shall begin to say, ‘We have eaten and drunk in your presence, and you have taught in our streets.’

27.verse: “But he shall say, ‘I tell you. I do not know where you are from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity!’

28.verse: “There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the Prophets in the Kingdom of God; and yourselves thrust out at doors.

29.verse: “Then many shall come from the east and from the west and from the north and from the south and shall sit at table in the Kingdom of God.

30.verse: “And behold, there are last who shall be first. And there are first who shall be last.”

31.verse: The same day, some Pharisees came and said to Him, “Depart and go from here! For Herod wants to kill you!”

32.verse: Then He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and will keep healing today and tomorrow. And the third day I shall complete it.’

33.verse: “Nevertheless, I must walk today and tomorrow and the day after. For it cannot be that a Prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem.

34.verse: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the Prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together, as the hen gathers her brood under her wings. And you would not.

35.verse: “Behold, your house is left to you desolate. And truly I tell you, you shall not see Me until the time comes that you shall say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the Name of the Lord.’”

1.verse: And it happened that when He had entered into the house of one of the chief Pharisees on the Sabbath to eat bread, they watched Him.

2.verse: And behold, there was a certain man before Him who suffered from edema.

3.verse: Then Jesus answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”

4.verse: And they held their peace. Then He took him and healed him and let him go.

5.verse: And He answered them, saying, “Who of you shall have a donkey or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?”

6.verse: And again they could not answer Him about those things.

7.verse: He also spoke a parable to the guests when He noted how they selected the chief seats at the table, and said to them,

8.verse: “When you shall be invited by anyone to a wedding, do not sit yourself down in the place of honor, lest a more honorable than you be invited.

9.verse: And the one who invited both you and him comes and says to you, ‘Give this man that place.’ And then you begin (with shame) to take the lowest place.

10.verse: “But when you are invited, go and sit down at the lowest place. So that when the one who invited you comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, sit up higher.’ Then you shall have honor in the presence of those who sit at table with you.

11.verse: “For whoever exalts himself, shall be brought low. And the one who humbles himself, shall be exalted.”

12.verse: Then He also said to the one who had invited Him, “When you make a dinner or a supper, do not call your friends or your brothers or your kinsmen or the rich neighbors, so that they invite you in return, and a recompense be made to you.

13.verse: “But when you make a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind.

14.verse: “And you shall be blessed, because they cannot repay you. For you shall be recompensed at the Resurrection of the Just.

15.verse: Now when one of them who sat at table heard these things, he said to Him, “Blessed is he who eats bread in the Kingdom of God.”

16.verse: Then He said to him, “A certain man made a great supper, and invited many,

17.verse: “and sent his servant at supper time to say to those were invited, ‘Come. For all things are now ready.’

18.verse: “But they all, with one mind, began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a farm, and I must go out and see it. I ask you to have me excused.’

19.verse: “And another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen. And I go to test them. I ask that you have me excused.’

20.verse: “And another said, ‘I have married a wife. And therefore, I cannot come.’

21.verse: “So that servant returned and told his master these things. Then the good man of the house was angry, and said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city! And bring the poor in here, and the maimed, and the lame, and the blind!’

22.verse: “And the servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you have commanded. And still there is room.’

23.verse: “Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the highways and hedges and urge them to come in, so that my house may be filled.

24.verse: ‘For I say to you that none of those who were invited shall taste of my supper.’”

25.verse: Now great multitudes went with Him. And He turned and said to them,

26.verse: “If anyone comes to Me, and does not hate his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters - yes, and even his own life - he cannot be My disciple.

27.verse: “And whoever does not bear his cross and come after Me, cannot be My disciple.

28.verse: “For who of you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down beforehand and count the cost (whether he has the means to complete it),

29.verse: “lest after he has laid the foundation and is not able to complete it, all who behold it begin to mock him,

30.verse: “saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’

31.verse: Or what king - going to make war against another king - does not first sit down and take counsel on whether he is able (with ten thousand) to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?

32.verse: “Otherwise, while he is still a great way off, he sends ambassadors to ask for peace.

33.verse: “So likewise, whoever of you who does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple.

34.verse: “Salt is good. But if salt has lost its savor, with what shall it be salted?

35.verse: “It is fit neither for the land nor for manure. But it is cast out. The one who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

1.verse: Then all the tax collectors and sinners came to Him, to hear Him.

2.verse: Therefore, the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, “He receives sinners, and eats with them.”

3.verse: Then He spoke this parable to them, saying,

4.verse: “What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he loses one of them, does not leave ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after that which is lost until he finds it?

5.verse: “And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders with joy.

6.verse: “And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me! For I have found my sheep which was lost!’

7.verse: “I say to you that joy shall likewise be in Heaven for one sinner who converts, more than for ninety-nine righteous ones who have no need of repentance.

8.verse: “Or what woman having ten drachmas, if she loses one drachma, does not light a candle and sweep the house and seek diligently till she finds it?

9.verse: “And when she has found it, she calls her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me! For I have found the coin which I had lost!’

10.verse: “Likewise I say to you there is joy in the presence of the angels of God for one sinner who converts.”

11.verse: He said moreover, “A certain man had two sons.

12.verse: “And the younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the portion of the goods that falls to me.’ So, he divided his livelihood among them.

13.verse: “So, not many days after, when the younger son had gathered everything together, he took his journey into a far country. And there he wasted his goods with riotous living.

14.verse: “Now, when he had spent everything, there arose a great famine throughout that land. And he began to be in want.

15.verse: “Then he went and kept company with a citizen of that country. And he sent him to his farm to feed swine.

16.verse: “And he would have filled his belly with the husks that the swine ate, but no one gave him any.

17.verse: “Then he came to himself and said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have enough bread, and I die for hunger?

18.verse: ‘I will rise and go to my father, and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against Heaven, and before you,

19.verse: “and am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”’

20.verse: “So he arose and came to his father. And when he was still a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

21.verse: “And the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against Heaven, and before you, and am no more worthy to be called your son.’

22.verse: “Then the father said to his servants, ‘Bring forth the best robe and put it on him! And put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet!

23.verse: ‘And bring the fat calf and kill him! And let us eat and be merry!

24.verse: ‘For this my son was dead, and is alive again! And he was lost, but he is found!’ And they began to be merry.

25.verse: “Now the elder brother was in the field. And when he came and drew near to the house, he heard melody and dancing,

26.verse: “And he called one of his servants and asked what those things meant.

27.verse: “And he said to him, ‘Your brother has come. And your father has killed the fat calf because he has received him safe and sound.’

28.verse: “Then he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore, his father came out and implored him.

29.verse: “But he answered, and said to his father, ‘Lo, these many years I have done you service and have always obeyed you! And yet you never gave me a kid that I might make merry with my friends!

30.verse: ‘But when this, your son, had come - who had devoured your goods with harlots - you have killed the fat calf for his sake!’

31.verse: “And he said to him, “Son, you are always with me. And all that I have is yours. It was fitting that we should celebrate and be glad. For this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. And he was lost, but he is found.”

32.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

1.verse: And He also said to His disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a steward. And he was accused to him of wasting his goods.

2.verse: “And he called him and said to him, ‘How is it that I hear this of you? Give an account of your stewardship. For you may no longer be steward.’

3.verse: “Then the steward said within himself, ‘What shall I do? For my master is taking away the stewardship from me. I cannot dig. And I am ashamed to beg.

4.verse: ‘I know what I will do, so that when I am put out of the stewardship they may receive me into their houses.’

5.verse: “Then he called every one of his master’s debtors to him, and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my master?’

6.verse: “And he said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ And he said to him, ‘Take your bill. And sit down quickly. And write fifty.’

7.verse: “Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ And he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ Then he said to him, ‘Take your bill and write eighty.’

8.verse: “And the master commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely. For among their own kind, the children of this world are wiser than the children of light.

9.verse: “And I say to you, make friends with the riches of iniquity, so that when you fail, they may receive you into eternal dwellings.

10.verse: “The one who is faithful in the least, is also faithful in much. And the one who is unjust in the least, is unjust also in much.

11.verse: “If, then, you have not been faithful in the riches of iniquity, who will trust you in the true treasure?

12.verse: “And if you have not been faithful in another man’s goods, who shall give you that which is yours?

13.verse: “No servant can serve two masters. For either he shall hate the one and love the other. Or else he shall lean to the one, and despise the other. You cannot serve God and riches.”

14.verse: The Pharisees also heard all these things and were covetous. And they scoffed at Him.

15.verse: Then He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men. But God knows your hearts. For that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

16.verse: “The Law and the Prophets endured until John. And since that time the Kingdom of God is preached. And everyone presses into it.

17.verse: “Now it is easier for Heaven and earth to pass away than for one stroke of the Law to fall.

18.verse: “Whoever puts away his wife and marries another, commits adultery. And whoever marries the one who is put away from her husband, commits adultery.

19.verse: “There was a certain rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared well and delicately every day.

20.verse: “Also, there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, who was laid at his gate (full of sores).

21.verse: “And he desired to be refreshed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. And even the dogs came and licked his sores.

22.verse: “And it happened that the beggar died and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died and was buried.

23.verse: “And being in torment in hell, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham far off (and Lazarus in his bosom).

24.verse: “Then he cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! And send Lazarus, so that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue! For I am tormented in this flame!’

25.verse: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your pleasures, and likewise Lazarus pains. Therefore, now he is comforted and you are tormented.

26.verse: ‘Besides all this, there is a great gulf set between you and us, so that those who wish to go from here to you, cannot. Nor can anyone come from there to us.’

27.verse: “Then he said, ‘Therefore I ask you, father, if you would send him to my father’s house,

28.verse: ‘(for I have five brothers) so that he may testify to them, lest they also come into this place of torment.’

29.verse: “Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them hear them.’

30.verse: “And he said, ‘No, father Abraham. But if one came to them from the dead, they will repent.’

31.verse: “Then he said to him, ‘If they do not hear Moses and the Prophets, they will not be persuaded if one rises from the dead again.’”

1.verse: Then He said to His disciples, “It is impossible for stumbling blocks not to come. But, but woe to him by whom they come.

2.verse: “It would be better for him if a great millstone were hung around his neck and he were cast into the sea, than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.

3.verse: “Pay attention to yourselves. If your brother trespasses against you, rebuke him. And if he repents, forgive him.

4.verse: “And if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turns again to you, saying, “I repent”, you shall forgive him.”

5.verse: And the Apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”

6.verse: And the Lord said, “If you had faith as a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Pluck yourself up by the roots and plant yourself in the sea’, and it would obey you.

7.verse: “Also, who of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, would say to him when he comes from the field, ‘Come at once, and sit down to eat?’

8.verse: “Would you not rather say to him, ‘Prepare my supper and dress yourself. And serve me until I have eaten and drunk. And you eat and drink afterward?’

9.verse: “Does he thank that servant because he did that which was commanded? I think not.

10.verse: “So likewise you, when you have done all those things which are commanded of you, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants. We have done that which was our duty to do.’”

11.verse: And so it was when He went to Jerusalem, that He passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

12.verse: And as He entered into a certain town, ten leprous men met Him there, who stood at a distance.

13.verse: And they lifted up their voices and said, “Jesus! Master! Have mercy on us!”

14.verse: And when He saw, He said to them, “Go. Show yourselves to the priests.” And it happened that as they went, they were cleansed.

15.verse: Then one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice praised God,

16.verse: and fell down on his face at His feet and gave him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.

17.verse: And Jesus answered, and said, “Are there not ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

18.verse: “There is no one found who returned to give God praise, except this stranger?”

19.verse: And He said to him, “Arise. Go your way. Your faith has saved you.”

20.verse: And when He was asked by the Pharisees when the Kingdom of God would come, He answered them, and said, “The Kingdom of God does not come with observation.

21.verse: “Nor shall they say, ‘Lo, here!’ or “Lo, there!’ For behold, the Kingdom of God is within you.”

22.verse: And He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you shall not see it.

23.verse: “Then they shall say to you, ‘Behold here!’or ‘Behold there!’ Do not go there or follow them.

24.verse: “For as the lightning that flashes out of one part of heaven, shines into another part of heaven, so shall the Son of Man be in his day.

25.verse: “But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

26.verse: “And as it was in the days of Noah, so shall it be in the days of the Son of Man.

27.verse: “They ate, they drank, they married wives and gave in marriage, until the day that Noah went into the Ark. And the flood came and destroyed them all.

28.verse: “Also, as it was in the days of Lot. They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.

29.verse: But on the day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

30.verse: “So shall it be on the day when the Son of Man is revealed.

31.verse: “On that day, the one who is upon the house (and his stuff in the house), let him not come down to take it out. And likewise, the one who is in the field, let him not turn back to that which he left behind.

32.verse: “Remember Lot’s wife.

33.verse: “Whoever will seek to save his soul, shall lose it. And whoever shall lose it, shall preserve it.

34.verse: “I tell you, on that night there shall be two in one bed. The one shall be received, and the other shall be left.

35.verse: “Two women shall be grinding together. The one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

36.verse: “Two shall be in the field. One shall be received, and another shall be left.

37.verse: And they answered, and said to Him, “Where, Lord?” And He said to them, “Wherever the body is, there also shall the birds of prey be gathered together.”

1.verse: And He also spoke a parable to them showing that they ought always to pray and not grow weary,

2.verse: He said, “There was a judge in a certain city who neither feared God nor respected man.

3.verse: “And there was a widow in that city who came to him saying, ‘Do me justice against my adversary.’

4.verse: “And he would not do so for some time. But then, he said to himself, ‘I neither fear God nor respect man.

5.verse: ‘Yet because this widow troubles me I will do her right, lest she keeps coming and makes me weary.’”

6.verse: And the Lord said, “Hear what the unrighteous judge says.

7.verse: “Now, shall not God avenge His Elect, who cry day and night to Him, even though He bears with them a long time?

8.verse: “I tell you, He will avenge them quickly! But, when the Son of Man comes, shall He find faith on the earth?”

9.verse: He also spoke this parable to some who trusted in themselves (that they were just) and despised others.

10.verse: “Two men went up into the Temple to pray - the one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.

11.verse: “The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘O God, I thank You that I am not as other men - extortioners, unjust, adulterers - or even as this tax collector.

12.verse: ‘I fast twice a week. I give tithe of all that ever I possess.’

13.verse: “But the tax collector, standing at a distance, would not lift up so much as his eyes to Heaven. But he struck his breast, saying, ‘O God, be merciful to me, a sinner.’

14.verse: “I tell you, this man departed to his house more justified than the other. For everyone who exalts himself shall be brought low. And the one who humbles himself shall be exalted.”

15.verse: They also brought little children to Him, so that He could touch them. And when His disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

16.verse: But Jesus called them to Him, and said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them. For of such is the Kingdom of God.

17.verse: “Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the Kingdom of God as a little child, shall not enter therein.”

18.verse: Then a certain ruler asked Him, saying, “Good Master, what ought I to do to inherit eternal life?”

19.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good except One - God.

20.verse: “You know the commandments, ‘You shall not commit adultery. You shall not kill. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness. Honor your father and your mother.”

21.verse: And he said, “All these have I kept from my youth!”

22.verse: Now when Jesus heard that, He said to him, “Still, you lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute it to the poor. And you shall have treasure in Heaven. And come follow Me.”

23.verse: But when he heard those things, he was very sorrowful. For he was very rich.

24.verse: And when Jesus saw he was very sorrowful, He said, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

25.verse: “Surely it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

26.verse: Then those who heard it said, “And who then shall be saved?”

27.verse: And He said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

28.verse: Then Peter said, “Lo, we have left all and have followed You.”

29.verse: [p]And He said to them, “Truly I say to you there is no one who has left house, or parents, or brothers, or wife, or children, for the Kingdom of God’s sake,

30.verse: who shall not receive much more in this world - and in the world to come, eternal life.

31.verse: Then Jesus took the twelve to Him and said to them, “Behold, we go up to Jerusalem. And all things that are written of the Son of Man by the Prophets shall be fulfilled.

32.verse: “For He shall be delivered to the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and shall be mistreated, and shall be spit upon.

33.verse: “And when they have scourged Him, they will put Him to death. But the third day He shall rise again.”

34.verse: But they understood none of these things. And this saying was hidden from them. Nor did they perceive the things which were spoken.

35.verse: And it happened that as He came near to Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the wayside, begging.

36.verse: And when he heard the people pass by, he asked what it meant.

37.verse: And they said to him that Jesus of Nazareth passed by.

38.verse: Then he cried, saying, “Jesus, the Son of David! Have mercy on me!”

39.verse: And those who went before ordered him to be quiet. But he cried much more, “O, Son of David! Have mercy on me!”

40.verse: And Jesus stood still. And He commanded him to be brought to Him. And when he had come near, He asked him,

41.verse: saying, “What would you have Me do for you?” And he said, “Lord, that I may receive my sight.”

42.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has saved you.

43.verse: Then immediately he received his sight and followed Him, praising God. And all the people, when they saw, gave praise to God.

1.verse: Now when Jesus entered and passed through Jericho,

2.verse: behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, who was the chief receiver of the tribute. And he was rich.

3.verse: And he sought to see Jesus (who He was) and could not because of the crowd, for he was small in stature.

4.verse: Therefore he ran ahead and climbed up into a wild fig tree, so that he might see Him. For he would be coming that way.

5.verse: And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus! Come down at once! For today I must stay at your house!”

6.verse: Then he quickly came down and received him joyfully.

7.verse: And when they all saw it, they murmured, saying that He had gone to lodge with a sinful man.

8.verse: But Zacchaeus, standing, said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. And if I have taken from anyone by false accusation, I restore it to him fourfold.”

9.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house! Because he has also become the son of Abraham!

10.verse: “For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save those who have been lost.”

11.verse: And while they heard these things, He continued and spoke a parable (because He was near Jerusalem, and also because they thought that the Kingdom of God would shortly appear).

12.verse: Therefore, He said, “A certain nobleman went into a distant country to receive a kingdom for himself and then to return.

13.verse: “And he called his ten servants, and gave them ten minas, and said to them, ‘Do business until I come.’

14.verse: “Now, his citizens hated him, and sent ambassadors after him, saying, ‘We will not have this man reign over us!’

15.verse: “And it happened that when he had returned (and had received his kingdom) he commanded the servants to whom he had given his money be called to him, so that he might know what each had gained.

16.verse: “Then the first came, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has increased to ten minas.’

17.verse: “And he said to him, ‘Well, good servant! Because you have been faithful in a very little thing, take authority over ten cities!’

18.verse: “And the second came, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has increased to five minas.’

19.verse: “And to this one he said, ‘And you rule over five cities!’

20.verse: “So the other came, and said, ‘Lord, behold your mina, which I have put away in a handkerchief.

21.verse: ‘For I feared you because you are an exacting man. You take up what you did not lay down and reap what you did not sow.’

22.verse: “Then he said to him, ‘From your own mouth will I judge you, O evil servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up what I did not lay down and reaping what I did not sow.

23.verse: ‘Why, then, did you not give my money to the bank, so that I might have required it with interest when I came?’

24.verse: “And he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina from him and give it to him who has ten minas!’

25.verse: “And they said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas.’

26.verse: ‘For I say to you that to all those who have, it shall be given. And from the one who has not, even that he has shall be taken from him.

27.verse: ‘Moreover, bring my enemies here who do not wish to have me reign over them and kill them before me!’”

28.verse: And when He had said this, He went on ahead, ascending up to Jerusalem.

29.verse: And it happened that when He had come near Bethphage and Bethany (next to the mountain called the “Mount of Olives”), He sent two of his disciples,

30.verse: saying, “Go to the town before you, in which (as soon as you have entered) you shall find a colt, tied, whereupon no man ever sat. Untie it and bring it.

31.verse: “And if anyone asks you why you have untied it, you shall say this to him, ‘Because the Lord has need of it.’”

32.verse: So those who were sent went their way and found it as he had said to them.

33.verse: And as they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?!”

34.verse: And they said, “The Lord has need of it.”

35.verse: So they brought it to Jesus. And they cast their garments on the colt and sat Jesus upon it.

36.verse: And as He went, they spread their clothes along the way.

37.verse: And when He had now come near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God loudly for all the great works that they had seen,

38.verse: saying, “Blessed is the King Who comes in the Name of the Lord! Peace in Heaven! And glory in the highest places!”

39.verse: Then some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Him, “Master, rebuke Your disciples.”

40.verse: But He answered, and said to them, “I tell you that if these should be silent, the stones would cry.”

41.verse: And when He had come near, He looked at the city and wept for it,

42.verse: saying, “O, if you had known (even at the least, and on this your day) those things which belong to your peace! But now are they hidden from your eyes.

43.verse: “For the days shall come upon you that your enemies will cast a rampart around you, and surround you, and trap you on every side,

44.verse: “And shall make you even with the ground (and your children who are in you). And they shall not leave a stone upon a stone within you. Because you did not know the time of your visitation.”

45.verse: He also went into the Temple and began to cast out those inside who sold and bought,

46.verse: saying to them, “It is written! ‘My house is the house of prayer!’ But you have made it a den of thieves!”

47.verse: And He taught daily in the Temple. And the chief priests and the scribes, and the chief of the people sought to destroy Him.

48.verse: But they could not find what they might do to Him. For all the people hung upon Him when they heard Him.

1.verse: And it happened that on one of those days, as He taught the people in the Temple, and preached the Gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon Him, with the elders,

2.verse: and spoke to Him, saying, “Tell us by what authority You do these things? Or, who is he who has given You this authority?”

3.verse: And He answered, and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing. Therefore, tell me.

4.verse: “The baptism of John, was it from Heaven, or of men?

5.verse: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we shall say, ‘From Heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

6.verse: “But if we shall say, ‘Of men,’ all the people will stone us. For they are persuaded that John was a Prophet.”

7.verse: Therefore they answered that they could not tell from where it was.

8.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Nor shall I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

9.verse: Then He began to speak this parable to the people, “A certain man planted a vineyard, hired farmers, and went into a strange country for a long time.

10.verse: “And at the proper time, he sent a servant to the farmers to have them give him of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him and sent him away empty.

11.verse: “Again, he sent yet another servant. And they beat him, and treated him badly, and sent him away empty.

12.verse: “Moreover he sent the third. And they wounded him and cast him out.

13.verse: “Then the Lord said of the vineyard, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that they will respect him.’

14.verse: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned with themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, so that the inheritance may be ours.’

15.verse: “So they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him. Therefore, what shall the Lord of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: “He will come and destroy these farmers and will give his vineyard to others.” But when they heard it, they said, “May it never be!”

17.verse: And He looked at them, and said, “What, then, is the meaning of that which is written, ‘The stone that the builders refused, is made the head cornerstone?’

18.verse: “Whoever shall fall upon that stone, shall be broken. And whomever it shall fall upon will be ground into powder.”

19.verse: Then that same hour, the chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on Him, but they feared the people. For they perceived that He had spoken this parable against them.

20.verse: And they watched Him and sent forth spies to act like righteous men and take Him in His talk (and deliver Him to the power and authority of the governor).

21.verse: And they asked Him, saying, “Master, we know that You say and teach right, without partiality. And You teach the way of God truly.

22.verse: “Is it lawful for us to give Caesar tribute or not?”

23.verse: But He perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you tempt Me?

24.verse: “Show me a penny. Whose image and superscription does it have?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”

25.verse: Then He said to them, “Then, give to Caesar those things which are Caesar’s, and to God those which are God’s.”

26.verse: And they could not catch Him in His words before the people. But they marveled at His answer and were silent.

27.verse: Then some of the Sadducees came to Him (who deny that there is any resurrection). And they asked Him,

28.verse: “Master, Moses wrote to us: ‘If anyone’s brother dies having a wife (and he dies without children), that his brother should take his wife and raise up seed to his brother.’

29.verse: “Now there were seven brothers. And the first took a wife, and he died without children.

30.verse: “And the second took the wife, and he died childless.

31.verse: “Then the third took her. And so likewise did all seven die and leave no children.

32.verse: “And last of all, the woman also died.

33.verse: “Therefore, at the resurrection, whose wife shall she be? For seven had her as wife.”

34.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said to them, “The sons of this world marry wives, and are married.

35.verse: “But those who shall be counted worthy to enjoy that World, (and the resurrection from the dead) neither marry wives nor are married.

36.verse: “For they can die no more, because they are equal to the angels and are the sons of God (since they are sons of the resurrection).

37.verse: “And even Moses showed that the dead shall rise again when, beside the bush, he said, ‘The Lord is the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

38.verse: “For He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. For all live for Him.”

39.verse: Then some of the scribes answered, and said, “Master, You have spoken well.”

40.verse: And after that, they did not ask Him anything at all.

41.verse: Then He said to them, “How can they say that Christ is David’s son?

42.verse: “And David himself says in the Book of the Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand,

43.verse: “Till I shall make your enemies your footstool.?”’

44.verse: “Seeing David called Him Lord, how then is He his son?

45.verse: Then He said to His disciples (in front of all the people),

46.verse: “Beware of the scribes who willingly walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets and the highest seats in the assemblies and the chief places at feasts!

47.verse: “They devour widows’ houses and make long prayers for show! These shall receive greater damnation!”

1.verse: And as He looked, He saw the rich, who cast their gifts into the treasury.

2.verse: And He also saw a certain poor widow, who cast in two lepta.

3.verse: And He said, “Truly I say to you that this poor widow has cast in more than all of them.

4.verse: “For they have all cast into the offerings of God out of their excess. But she, out of her poverty, has cast in all her livelihood.”

5.verse: Now as some spoke of the Temple (how it was decorated with beautiful stones and consecrated things), He said,

6.verse: “Are these the things that you look upon? The days will come when a stone shall not be left upon a stone; that it shall not be thrown down.”

7.verse: Then they asked Him, saying, “Master, but when shall these things be? And what sign shall there be when these things shall happen?”

8.verse: And He said, “Watch carefully, so that you are not deceived. For many will come in My Name, saying, ‘I am Christ,’ and ‘The time draws near.’ Therefore, do not follow them.

9.verse: “And when you hear of wars and revolutions, do not be afraid. For these things must come first. But the end will not follow right away.”

10.verse: Then He said to them, “Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

11.verse: “And great earthquakes shall occur in diverse places. And hunger and pestilence and fearful things and great signs from Heaven shall happen.

12.verse: “But before all these things, they shall lay their hands on you and persecute you - delivering you up to the assemblies and into prisons - and bring you before kings and rulers, for My Name’s sake.

13.verse: “And this shall result in a testimonial for you.

14.verse: “Therefore, resolve in your hearts not to prepare what you shall answer beforehand.

15.verse: “For I will give you a mouth, and wisdom, against which all your adversaries shall not be able to speak or resist.

16.verse: “Indeed, you shall also be betrayed by your parents and by your brothers, and kinsmen, and friends. And they shall put you to death.

17.verse: “And you shall be hated by all, for My Name’s sake.

18.verse: “Yet, not one hair of your heads shall perish.

19.verse: “By your patience, gain your souls.

20.verse: “And when you see Jerusalem besieged by soldiers, then understand that its desolation is near.

21.verse: “Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. And let those who are in the city depart. And do not let those who are in the country enter.

22.verse: “For these are the days of vengeance, to fulfill all things that are written.

23.verse: “But woe to those who are with child, and to those who nurse, in those days. For there shall be great distress in this land, and wrath over this people.

24.verse: “And they shall fall on the edge of the sword and shall be led as captives into all nations. And Jerusalem shall be trampled under the feet of the Gentiles, until the time of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

25.verse: “Then there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars, and trouble upon the earth among the nations, with confusion. The sea and the waters shall roar.

26.verse: And men’s hearts shall fail them for fear and for looking after those things which shall come upon the world. For the powers of Heaven shall be shaken.

27.verse: “And then shall they see the Son of Man come in a cloud, with power and great glory.

28.verse: “And when these things begin to happen, then look up and lift up your heads! For your redemption draws near!”

29.verse: And He spoke to them a parable, “Look at the fig tree, and all trees,

30.verse: “as they now spring forth. When you see them, you know that summer is now near.

31.verse: “So likewise, when you see these things happen, you know that the Kingdom of God is near.

32.verse: “Truly I say to you this age shall not pass until all things are done.

33.verse: “Heaven and Earth shall pass away, but My words shall not pass away.

34.verse: “Pay attention to yourselves, so that your hearts are never oppressed with excess and drunkenness and cares of this life. And so that the Day does not take you by surprise.

35.verse: “For it shall come as a trap upon all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth.

36.verse: “Watch, therefore, and pray continually. So that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that shall happen. And so that you may stand before the Son of Man.”

37.verse: Now in the daytime, He taught in the Temple. And at night, He went out and stayed on the mount that is called the Mount of Olives.

38.verse: And in the morning, all the people came to hear Him in the Temple.

1.verse: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread drew near (which is called the Passover).

2.verse: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill Him. For they feared the people.

3.verse: Then Satan entered into Judas (who was called Iscariot and was among the number of the twelve).

4.verse: And he went his way and discussed with the chief priests and captains how he might betray Him to them.

5.verse: So they were glad and agreed to give him money.

6.verse: And he consented and sought opportunity to betray Him to them when the people were away.

7.verse: Then the Day of Unleavened Bread came (when the Passover must be sacrificed).

8.verse: And He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, so that we may eat it.”

9.verse: And they said to Him, “Where would You have us prepare it?”

10.verse: Then He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man bearing a pitcher of water shall meet you. Follow him into the house where he enters.

11.verse: “And say to the good man of the house, ‘The Master says to you, “Where is the lodging where I shall eat My Passover with My disciples?”’

12.verse: “Then he will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make it ready there.”

13.verse: So they went and found as He had said to them. And they made ready the Passover.

14.verse: And when the hour had come, He sat down (and the twelve Apostles with Him).

15.verse: Then He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

16.verse: “For I say to you that I will not eat of it again until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.”

17.verse: And He took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, “Take this, and divide it among you.”

18.verse: For I say to you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the Kingdom of God comes.”

19.verse: And He took bread. And when He had given thanks, He broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body, which is given for you. Do this in the remembrance of Me.”

20.verse: Likewise, after supper, He took the cup, saying, “This cup is the New Testament in My blood, which is shed for you.

21.verse: “Still, the hand of him who betrays Me is with Me at the table.

22.verse: “And truly the Son of Man goes as it is appointed. But woe to that man by whom He is betrayed.”

23.verse: Then they began to inquire among themselves about which one it could be who would do that.

24.verse: And there also arose among them a dispute about which one was thought to be the greatest.

25.verse: But He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles reign over them. And those who bear rule over them are called benefactors.

26.verse: “But you shall not be so. But let the greatest among you be as the least; and the chief as he who serves.

27.verse: “For who is greater, the one who sits at table, or the one who serves? Is not the one who sits at table? And I am among you as one who serves.

28.verse: “And you are those who have continued with Me in My trials.

29.verse: “Therefore I appoint to you a kingdom, as my Father has appointed to Me,

30.verse: “So that you may eat and drink at My table, in My kingdom; and sit on seats and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: And the Lord said, “Simon. Simon, behold! Satan has asked for you, to sift you as wheat.

32.verse: “But I have prayed for you, that your faith does not fail. Therefore, when you have repented, strengthen your brothers.”

33.verse: And he said to Him. “Lord, I am ready to go with You into prison, and to death!”

34.verse: But He said, “I tell you, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before you have thrice denied that you knew Me.”

35.verse: And He said to them, “When I sent you without bag and purse and shoes, did you lack anything?” And they said, “Nothing.”

36.verse: Then He said to them, “But now he who has a bag, let him take it, and likewise a purse. And he who has none, let him sell his coat, and buy a sword.

37.verse: “For I say to you that the same which is written must still be performed in Me: ‘He was numbered with the wicked.’ For doubtless those things which are written of Me have an end.”

38.verse: And they said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It is enough.”

39.verse: And He came out and went to the mount of Olives (as was His custom). And His disciples also followed Him.

40.verse: And when He came to the place, He said to them, “Pray, lest you enter into temptation.”

41.verse: And He was drawn aside from them (about a stone’s cast) and kneeled down and prayed,

42.verse: saying, “Father. If You will, take away this cup from Me. Nevertheless, not My will. But Yours be done.”

43.verse: And an angel from Heaven appeared to Him, to comfort Him.

44.verse: But being in an agony, He prayed more earnestly. And His sweat was like drops of blood, trickling down to the ground.

45.verse: And He rose up from prayer, and came to his disciples, and found them asleep from sorrow.

46.verse: And He said to them, “Why do you sleep?! Rise and pray, lest you enter into temptation.”

47.verse: And while He was still speaking, a crowd appeared. And he who was called Judas (one of the twelve) went before them and came near to Jesus to kiss Him.

48.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Judas, you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

49.verse: Now, when those who were around Him saw what would follow, they said to Him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

50.verse: And one of them struck a servant of the High Priest; and struck off his right ear.

51.verse: Then Jesus answered, and said, “Enough!” And He touched his ear and healed him.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, and captains of the Temple, and the elders who had come to Him, “Have you come out as for a thief, with swords and clubs?

53.verse: “When I was with you daily in the Temple, you did not stretch forth hands against Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness!”

54.verse: Then took they Him, and led Him, and brought Him to the High Priest’s house. And Peter followed at a distance.

55.verse: And when they had kindled a fire in the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter also sat down among them.

56.verse: And a certain maid saw him as he sat by the fire and, having looked at him intently, said, “This man was also with Him!”

57.verse: But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him!”

58.verse: And after a little while, another saw him, and said, “You are also one of them!” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”

59.verse: And about an hour after that, another affirmed, saying, “Truly, this man was also with Him! For he is also a Galilean!”

60.verse: And Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are talking about!” And immediately while he was still speaking, the cock crew.

61.verse: Then the Lord turned back and looked at Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord; how He had said to him, “Before the cock crows, you shall deny Me three times.”

62.verse: And Peter went out and wept bitterly.

63.verse: And the men who held Jesus mocked Him and struck Him.

64.verse: And when they had blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face, and asked Him, saying, “Prophesy who it is that struck You!”

65.verse: And they blasphemously spoke many other things against Him.

66.verse: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led Him into their council,

67.verse: saying, “Are You the Christ? Tell us!” And He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe it.

68.verse: “And also, if I ask you, you will not answer Me, nor let Me go.

69.verse: “From now on, the Son of Man shall sit at the right hand of the power of God.

70.verse: Then they all said, “Are You, then, the Son of God?!” And He said to them, “You say that I am.”

71.verse: Then they said, “What need do we have of any further witness? For we ourselves have heard it from His own mouth!”

1.verse: Then the whole multitude of them arose and led Him to Pilate.

2.verse: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We have found this Man perverting the nation and forbidding to pay tribute to Caesar, saying that He is Christ, a King!”

3.verse: And Pilate asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” And He answered him, and said, “You say it.”

4.verse: Then Pilate said to the chief priests, and to the people, “I find no fault in this Man.”

5.verse: But they were all the more insistent, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning at Galilee, and as far as this place!”

6.verse: Now, when Pilate heard ‘Galilee’, he asked whether the Man was a Galilean.

7.verse: And when he knew that he was from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod (who was also in Jerusalem in those days).

8.verse: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was extremely glad. For he had desired to see Him for a long time (because he had heard many things about him and had hoped to have seen some sign done by Him).

9.verse: Then he questioned Him about many things. But He answered him nothing.

10.verse: Also, the chief priests and scribes stood forth and accused Him vehemently.

11.verse: And Herod, with his men of war, despised Him and mocked Him, and clothed Him in bright apparel, and again sent Him to Pilate.

12.verse: And the same day, Pilate and Herod became friends (for before they were enemies of one another).

13.verse: Then Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

14.verse: and said to them, “You have brought this Man to me as one Who perverted the people! And behold, I have examined Him before you and have found no fault in this Man concerning those things whereof you accuse Him!

15.verse: “No, nor Herod either! For I sent you to him. And lo, nothing worthy of death was done by Him!

16.verse: Therefore, I will discipline Him and let Him loose.

17.verse: (For it was necessary that he release one to them at the Feast.)

18.verse: Then all the multitude cried at once, saying, “Away with Him! And deliver Barabbas to us!”

19.verse: (who had been put in prison for a certain insurrection made in the city, and for murder).

20.verse: Then Pilate spoke to them again, willing to release Jesus.

21.verse: But they cried, saying, “Crucify! Crucify Him!”

22.verse: And he said to them a third time, “But, what evil has He done? I find no cause for death in Him! I will therefore discipline Him and let Him loose!”

23.verse: But they were insistent with loud voices and required that He be crucified. And their voices, and those of the chief priests, prevailed.

24.verse: So Pilate gave sentence, that it should be as they required.

25.verse: And he released to them the one whom they desired (who had been cast into prison for insurrection and murder) and delivered Jesus to their will.

26.verse: And as they led Him away, they caught one Simon of Cyrene, coming out of the field. And they laid the cross on him, to bear it after Jesus.

27.verse: And a great multitude of the people followed Him; and also women, who mourned and lamented Him.

28.verse: But Jesus turned back to them, and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me. But weep for yourselves, and for your children.

29.verse: “For behold, the days will come when it shall be said, ‘Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the breasts which never nursed.’

30.verse: “Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’

31.verse: “For if they do these things to a green tree, what shall be done to the dry?”

32.verse: And there were two others who were criminals, being led with Him to be slain.

33.verse: And when they had come to the place which is called Calvary, they crucified Him and the criminals there - one on the right hand and the other on the left.

34.verse: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them! For they do not know what they do!” And they divided His clothing and cast lots.

35.verse: And the people stood and looked on. And the rulers mocked Him with them, saying, “He saved others! Let Him save Himself if He is the Christ! The Chosen of God!”

36.verse: The soldiers also mocked Him, and came and offered Him vinegar,

37.verse: and said, “If You are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”

38.verse: And an inscription was also written over Him, in Greek letters, and in Latin, and in Hebrew, “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

39.verse: And one of the criminals who were hanged, railed at Him, saying, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us!”

40.verse: But the other answered, and rebuked him, saying, “Do you not fear God, seeing you are in the same condemnation?

41.verse: “We are indeed here righteously! For we receive things worthy of what we have done. But this Man has done nothing wrong!”

42.verse: And he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me, when You come into Your kingdom.

43.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you, today you shall be with Me in Paradise.”

44.verse: And it was about the sixth hour. And there was a darkness over all the land, until the ninth hour.

45.verse: And the sun was darkened. And the veil of the Temple was torn in the middle.

46.verse: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and said, “Father! Into Your hands I commend My spirit. And when He had said this, He gave up the ghost.

47.verse: Now when the centurion saw what had been done, he glorified God, saying, “Surely this Man was just.”

48.verse: And all the people that came together to that sight, observing the things which had been done, struck their breasts and returned.

49.verse: And those who knew Him stood at a distance - and the women who followed Him from Galilee – observing these things.

50.verse: And behold, there was a man named Joseph, who was a counselor; a good man, and just.

51.verse: He had not consented to their counsel and deeds. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews. He also waited for the Kingdom of God.

52.verse: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

53.verse: And he took it down and wrapped it in a linen cloth and laid it in a tomb, hewn out of a rock (in which no one had ever yet laid).

54.verse: And that day was the Preparation. And the Sabbath drew near.

55.verse: And also the women who followed (who came with Him from Galilee) saw the sepulcher, and how His body was laid.

56.verse: And they returned and prepared odors, and ointments, and rested on the Sabbath, according to the commandment.

1.verse: Now, early in the morning on the first day of the week, they (and some women with them) came to the sepulcher and brought the spices which they had prepared.

2.verse: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulcher.

3.verse: And they went in but did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: And it happened that (as they were perplexed by this) behold, two men suddenly stood by them in shining garments.

5.verse: And being afraid, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them, “Why do you seek Him who lives among the dead?

6.verse: “He is not here but is risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee,

7.verse: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.”

8.verse: And they remembered his words,

9.verse: and returned from the sepulcher, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the remnant.

10.verse: Now it was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James, and other women with them who told these things to the Apostles.

11.verse: But their words seemed like nonsense to them, and they did not believe them.

12.verse: Then Peter arose and ran to the sepulcher and looked in and saw the linen clothes laid by themselves. And he departed, wondering to himself what had happened.

13.verse: And behold, that same day two of them went to a town called Emmaus, which was about sixty furlongs from Jerusalem.

14.verse: And they talked together of all these things that had happened.

15.verse: And it happened that as they talked together, and reasoned, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.

16.verse: But their eyes were prevented from recognizing Him.

17.verse: And He said to them, “What kind of conversations are these that you are having as you walk and are sad?”

18.verse: And the one named Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You only a stranger in Jerusalem, and have not known the things which have happened there in these days?”

19.verse: And He said to them, “What things?” And they said to Him, “Of Jesus of Nazareth, Who was a Prophet, mighty in deed and in word before God and all people.

20.verse: “And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death and have crucified Him.

21.verse: “But we had hoped that it was He Who would deliver Israel. And today is the third day since all these things happened.

22.verse: “Indeed, and some women among us (who came early to the sepulcher) astonished us.

23.verse: “And when they did not find His body, they came, saying that they had also seen a vision of angels. Who said that He was alive.

24.verse: Therefore, some of them who were with us, went to the sepulcher and found it just as the women had said. But they did not see Him.”

25.verse: Then He said to them, “O fools! And slow of heart to believe all that the Prophets have spoken!

26.verse: “Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into His glory?”

27.verse: And He began at Moses, and at all the Prophets, and interpreted for them the things which were written of Him in all the Scriptures.

28.verse: And they drew near to the town where they were going. And He pretended like He was going further.

29.verse: But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us! For it is towards evening, and the day is far spent!” So, He went in to stay with them.

30.verse: And it happened that as He sat at table with them, He took the bread, and blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.

31.verse: Then their eyes were opened. And they knew Him. And He vanished.

32.verse: And they said among themselves, “Did not our hearts burn within us while He talked with us along the way and when He opened the Scriptures to us?”

33.verse: And they rose up that same hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together,

34.verse: who said, “The Lord has indeed risen and has appeared to Simon!”

35.verse: Then they told them what had happened along the way, and how He was known by them in the breaking of bread.

36.verse: And as they spoke these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them and said to them, “Peace to you.”

37.verse: But they were terrified and full of fear, thinking that they had seen a spirit.

38.verse: Then He said to them, “Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?

39.verse: “Look at My hands and My feet. For it is I, Myself. Touch Me and see. For a spirit does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”

40.verse: And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and feet.

41.verse: And while they still did not believe for joy, and wondered, He said to them, “Do you have any food here?”

42.verse: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.

43.verse: And He took it and ate before them.

44.verse: And He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you - that all which is written of Me in the Law of Moses, and in the Prophets, and in the Psalms, must be fulfilled.

45.verse: Then He opened their minds, so that they might understand the Scriptures.

46.verse: And said to them, “Thus is it written. And thus it was necessary for Christ to suffer and to rise again from the dead the third day,

47.verse: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His Name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

48.verse: “Now, you are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: And behold, I send the promise of My Father upon you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are filled with power from on high.”

50.verse: Afterward, He led them out into Bethany, and lifted up His hands and blessed them.

51.verse: And it happened that, as He blessed them, He departed from them and was carried up into Heaven.

52.verse: And they worshipped Him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,

53.verse: and were continually in the Temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
